column1: In some cases, trichorrhexis nodosa is caused be an underlying disorder, such as: - Thyroid not making enough thyroid hormone (hypothyroidism) - Buildup of ammonia in the body (argininosuccinic aciduria) - Iron deficiency - Menkes syndrome (Menkes kinky hair syndrome) - Group of conditions in which there is abnormal development of the skin, hair, nails, teeth, or sweat glands (ectodermal dysplasia) - Trichothiodystrophy (inherited disorder that causes brittle hair, skin problems, and intellectual disability)
In African Americans, looking at the scalp area using a microscope shows that the hair breaks off at the scalp area before it grows long.
If you have a disorder that is causing your trichorrhexis nodosa, it will be treated.

Your provider may recommend measures to reduce damage to your hair such as: - Gentle brushing with a soft brush instead of aggressive brushing or ratting - Avoiding harsh chemicals such as those used in straightening compounds and perms - Not using a very hot hair dryer for long periods and not ironing the hair - Using a gentle shampoo and a hair conditioner
